text: Hi Alex! Hope you are good. I've just finished my dissertation unit at university and I am starting to design my first environment to work on. Just thought I would say Hi and see how things are going :+1:
Hey hey, good to hear from you! Nice, nice, what comes in your mind? What kind of env are you aiming for?

This project has to involve my own concept so I am thinking of designing some sort of alternate history. I haven't committed to a concept yet as I need to do some more brainstorming but my first idea was a system where humans had to start living underground in large tower blocks which can rise and lower above and under the ground. For whichever concept I decide to aim for, I will want probably an establishing shot, an interior shot and maybe some close detail shots. Those can maybe be stills though depending on the deadline.
Cool man, sounds a lot like metro univers :slightly_smiling_face: Do you know about megascans and unreal being free now? It can boost your quality level through the roof

Yes kind of that metro post-apocalypse style but where we have developed technology to take buildings up and down using big platforms(it's only very tough right now haha) I've not heard about that no! Do you think it is worth using ( or I will have enough time to learn it?) In the 6/7 months I have to build my showreel?
You'll need epic account for that
Sounds epic man... to epic TBH :slightly_smiling_face: That project will take you 12-14 hours a day of none stop work to make it up to a VFX quality :slightly_smiling_face:

Okay thanks I'll have a look into that! Yeah I need to design the shots carefully so I can get all of my skills into some really really nice shots but not over-do it so that I dont waste my time on unecessary shots
So are you aiming to be a concept artist?

No, my ideal role would be some sort of Environment 3D role whether that is Generalist or TD or somethung similar (I know lots of companies have different names and roles for certain jobs). However for this project, my university want me to use an original concept which I have to design. And then after this I will probably do one based on another person's concept.
